title: Super  long queue times
body:
Hi, I am a super casual gamer who spams ARAMs and sometimes normals. 

It's come to my attention that it takes so long for me to get a game. Even when the average queue time is at 1min~1:30, it takes me at least 5 minutes to get a game going and this is excluding the time the game gets dodged during picks. 

I wondered what the reason was and first thought it might be because I am unranked and the system tries to match people with similar ranks?
But although I don't play ranked now, I used to until last year and I should have mmr of at least high plat or diamond 5. And back then I had no trouble getting a queue as they were either at around the average wait time or lower. 

Do I have to play a bit of ranked to get myself into ranked just to get a better queue time or is there simply less people in OCE server?

replies.body:
Im lvl 7 (Im new)

It takes 10 seconds to find a bot game
While I have to wait 30mins for a game

It depends on the time, I find it queue times after 1 am for aram is a long wait probably 10 minutes . After the 10 minute wait, I typically just play with the same group of players that was in my aram game.  ( Btw I was soloing)   But if you don't want to wait, playing in the evening and afternoon is much more faster since more players are usually on around that time. 

I was Diamond last season too and I am pretty sure mmr doesn't affect who you match up with in aram but norms may be another matter. Since norms, I typically get matched up with people that placed the same as me last season or higher.
Most of the time I'm getting queues of 30-40 min. Sometimes as long as an hour. OCE Bronze ranked top/jgl. Might be time to give dota 2 a go.
because my guess is 75% are on normals 20% and 5% are on aram

There are less people on the OCE server so things are usually a bit slower. You don't need to get ranked as normals MMR and Ranked MMR are unrelated.

To speed things up a bit, I would suggest[ joining a club](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/clubs) so you can always queue as a premade 5 (you also get more IP, mastery points and hextech stuff).
